column4: What does the following command do? sudo sed -i 's/apache2\/mod_mono.conf/apache2\/mods-enabled\/mod_mono.conf/g'
alright I know that the -i (from the man pages) stands for in place substitution....
is the brackets like /apache2/ the things we are looking for ?
correct way for to do what that command likely is trying to do: sudo a2enmod mod_mono
